title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Fast simple easy open ended questions lots of information about company give me a time when question uses stars panel style multiple rounds of interviews virtual interview questions about three different styles
Interview Questions: What are strengths and opportunities

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC)
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview for the chemistry PhD program. There was a academic application and once admitted you were brought to campus for a visitation weekend to get to know the department
Interview Questions: There were no interview questions.

title: Associate Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Thorough, but with clear communication. Respectful of time and provided multiple opportunities to connect with everyone in the department to determine if good fit. Questions focused on job competency and fit within the team.
Interview Questions: What is the largest gift you've secured?

title: Stock Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Meet and greet sat down with the manager and supervisor they both asked various questions that pertain to my role also included off the job time to get an understanding of background of who I am as a person, interview was very welcoming I feel right at home in a part of the team from the start.
Interview Questions: How I just under pressure in a fast pace environment.

title: MBA Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Prepare STAR stories for common question types like conflict, leadership, failure, achievement, etc. Interview done by either admissions team or external agents. Be confident, answer in STAR format, focus on your leadership skills throughout and do not forget to ask good questions in the end of the interview to show that you have do not your research.
Interview Questions: Why MBA Why UNC Why are you a good fit

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy and the interviewers were friendly. They asked me to share my previous work experience. They got back to me the next day with an offer which i accepted
Interview Questions: describe your previous work experience

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Two meetings, two different interviews, both were vague and didn't want to talk about actual responsibilities and tasks required of the job. Overall very easy going and can be done virtually
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Reasearch Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: The process was tedious and I felt as if the final interview was unnecessary, and I was interviewed by individuals that I ended up not working with day to day.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: interview process will vary a lot depending on where you apply to be a research assistant. You will likely have 2 online interviews but this will vary with the size of research project
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work on this study

title: Communication Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Applied for role and interviewed 3 months later. The interview was remote with one person from the department. However, it was recorded to be reviewed by others on the hiring panel.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role? Tell me about yourself and your experience.

title: Junior Digital Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Very chill, panel-style on Zoom, but this was during the pandemic so it might have changed since then. I mostly just talked about my creative passions and experience and only had the one interview
Interview Questions: Describe your extracurricular activities and commitments on or off campus

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very Smooth, punctual , fair questions , welcoming non discriminatory, scenarios, sense of humor , non judgmental , professional , kind , fair, lasted about a half hour or so and I did not feel rushed at all
Interview Questions: What is an idea you presented at a job and was approved

title: Clinical Nurse II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Very quick to interview and move through to the hiring and offer process. Sign on bonus and relocation offered. Orientation was quick to schedule. Background check was easy and automated.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Technical interview including machine learning theory/logic and software development skills. Asked what my vision was with the lab and asked questions that were correlated with my research interest. I was asked about what my technical background was, and the classes that I took to acquire the knowledge.
Interview Questions: What is your research interest?

title: IT Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Simple and straightforward, were clear about pay. In person at the time, unsure of now. Be sure to bring resume into the meeting if you feel you need to. Also enjoyed speaking with the person.
Interview Questions: Prior experience, degree level, and etc.

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Email via Campus Rec or you can email the supervisor of UNC aquatics to see if they are hiring. You can also go in as they are open throughout the day.
Interview Questions: Give us a time you worked in a team

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: The process was very straightforward, and didn't get dragged out. I was asked about my strengths and weaknesses, and my specific interest in the lab. After communicating this, I was allowed the space to ask questions about the lab and the environment.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this lab, specifically? How would it help you in the future?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Online application on the university department's website (library, housing, etc.).  Invited to interview with a department supervisor for approximately thirty minutes.  Decision/offer was communicated within a week of conducting the interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the University?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: It was difficult to find the location, and they did not reimburse for parking. The interview parameters were unclear based on past higher education experiences. It would be helpful it they provided a transparent outline of their process ahead of time.
Interview Questions: What experiences would you bring to the role?

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a 30 min Zoom call. There were three interviewers—the director of the lab, the direct supervisor, and a director of a similar lab. The interviewers asked mostly situational questions and asked about why I was interested in the job. While the interviewers were nice and friendly, they just seemed to be going through the motions of asking questions.
Interview Questions: How have your dealt with a difficult person? How do you manage conflicting responsibilities?

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: The interview was mainly a behavioral interview that was aimed at making sure I would be a good fit. The questions asked were centered around my past work experiences, including working as a part of a team and managing independent work.
Interview Questions: What are your 5-year goals?

title: MEL Associate  Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Employees were direct with expectations. Recruiting officer where helpful throughout onboarding process and transition was smooth. Recruiting officers are upfront with benefits that come with the job and salary expectations
Interview Questions: Are you eligible to work in the US?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: started off by having a brief introduction of myself, and then professional questions related to the ongoing research project, chit-chat, salary expectation, subject related questions on techinical detail, and questions to ask about their team
Interview Questions: how to efficienty conduct experiments

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: It was an interesting process. I was allowed to give background about my self for the first part of the interview. Then the interviewer gave good information about the position, responsibilities, and goals.
Interview Questions: What are your interests in this position?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Really great, simple interview. Knew the decision within a couple days. Asked questions about myself and why I would be good for this job. Interviewer was very friendly and personable. Pretty much a straightforward process.
Interview Questions: Why are you the ideal candidate for this position?

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: The process was fine what more can I say, very typical process Hr then team review. All I can remember about it at this point in time. It was fine
Interview Questions: They asked me many questions

title: Pharmacy School Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: MMI format. We rotate with different interviewers, each asking 1-2 questions. If you finished your answers and there is still time left, they will ask follow-up questions or an additional question. It was pretty casual.
Interview Questions:
Why did you want to apply for pharmacy school?
Why UNC?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: In-person interview on campus with a sole member of the lab and then with the entire lab in a weekly lab meeting to test the fit. faculty recommendations required and shared among the lab, questions about goals for the lab work and questions about past experience
Interview Questions: What are you looking to contribute to the lab?

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Multi-person interview day with multiple rooms involved. Interview day included a discussion with current residents. Very professional conduct on the part of the department. However, it did feel a little bit standoffish.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? What are your strengths and weaknesses? What makes a good resident?

title: Account Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Baltimore, MD) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a very easy to schedule interview. Interview was performed through google meet. The interview went well. Very engaging interviewer. Interviewer was very positive about company. The interviewer was very open to questions.
Interview Questions: leadership style, strengths & weaknesses, why interested in job

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: I went on 4 interviews, and was number 2, and didn't get the position. The third and fourth interviews were with teams of people, and afterward I walked around and met several people the position would work with.
Interview Questions: My strengths and my weaknesses

title: Summer Administrative Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: It was a great process! All the interviewees were super kind and accommodating. Just had 1 zoom interview with three hospital administrators. They were super helpful and passionate about their work!
Interview Questions: What is something our healthcare system need to improve on?

title: Technology Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: I submitted the required documents online through the UNC Jobs system website.  After submission, I was contacted via telephone for an initial interview.  Questions included basic troubleshooting techniques, step by step procedures during a support session, and previous experience with a range of IT related disciplines.
Interview Questions: How would you provide support for a faculty member experiencing an issue during a lecture?

title: Patient Intake Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process was quick and easy, what took a while is the start date for training. The process was pretty straight forward. Once the interview was done i received a call within a few days with an offer.
Interview Questions: What qualifies me for the position. To explain my experience.

title: Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview followed up by a zoom interview. It was a very easy process and communication was easy with the hiring supervisor. Each one was about 30 minutes long.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you like about your job and one thing you don't?

title: Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Interviews were with HR and Hiring supervisor. Well thought out questions and knew job description very well!  Went over my resume in detail to make sure It was authentic and that I conducted and knew past projects very well.
Interview Questions: Why was I interested in research

title: IT Analyst/Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: One of the most disrespectful processes I’ve ever gone through. Over 3 months and still can’t tell me if I was hired or not. Why do they think it’s okay to treat candidates this way?
Interview Questions: What makes you interested in this position?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Sent resume, followed up, had an initial screening call with supervisor, then had a formal group interview. Standard questions and they gave a good overview of the position. I felt like I had a good idea of what the position would entail.
Interview Questions: Describe your working style and a time you worked on a team

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview with nothing tricky or weird thrown in. I was asked a couple of very general technical questions (very straight-forward for the area I’d be working). Overall a pretty relaxing interview and I could tell the interviewers were genuine and mainly focused on getting to know me.
Interview Questions: Factors and decisions about your current job that lead to you seeking this particular position.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC)
Interview Descriptions: I applied with a CV and cover letter online, then met with the program director for about an hour before receiving offer for position. It was an informal interview and more like a conversation than a grilling
Interview Questions: Why did you come to UNC

title: Reg Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: First HR team approaches then the manager contacts directly, sets an interview date, and teams video meeting, Friendly team, detail-oriented, questions based on skill, sets, education, experience, certifications. once selected send in the references, skill set survey
Interview Questions: What is teamwork for you

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews. First was technical and the second was cultural fit. The technical interview was quite general. Basically how I would use the skills I had gathered to function I'm this position.
Interview Questions: How will you handle working under pressure?

title: Health Screener Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: The tone of the interview was very welcoming and friendly. Felt like a natural conversation and I could easily share experience as well as ask any questions I had for myself.
Interview Questions: Hardest moment at previous job.

title: Applications Analyst/Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: The 1st round consisted of an hour-long Zoom call with the hiring manager and other people I'd work with. No hard questions asked. It felt more like a conversation about an introduction to the team, job duties, asking about my experience, and answering any questions I had. The 2nd round was a 30-minute phone call with the hiring manager recapping the position, making sure I understood the duties and answering any other questions I had. Overall, the process was great and everyone seemed friendly and accomodating.
Interview Questions: How would you rate your SQL skills?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a smooth and straightforward process. Very friendly, asked all basic questions expected, no surprise questions. That is pretty much all there is to it, don't really know what else........
Interview Questions: What are two big strengths and and one weakness?

title: Account Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Applied through a temp service and they submitted my profile and the client was interested. Met with the temp agency at UNC Chapel and had an interview with 2 people for about an hour. They made me feel comfortable and relaxed during the entire interview process.
Interview Questions:
1. Tell me about yourself
2. Walk me through your resume 
3. Oracle Peoplesoft experience

title: Computer Programmer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my work experience and why I wanted to work on the projects available. I was asked to show code I had written and walk the interviewer through my projects.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Raleigh, NC) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very well, team was very receptive and positive. The first interview was with a small group. The second interview was a fully day.  They seemed like a great team and positive place to work, lots of chemistry. Very positive
Interview Questions: Mostly ensuring you responded to students in a timely fashion

title: Lab Animal Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Interview went pretty smoothly. Was asked the typical questions; tell me about yourself, where do you see yourself in 2 years, what is one of your weaknesses, how do you feel about animals being used for research.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself, where do you see yourself in 2 years, what is one of your weaknesses, how do you feel about animals being used for research?

title: Maintenance Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: The interview was direct and covered a range of expected details including background and experience in the field. The process did not take too long and was not overly difficult
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Had virtual interview in a welcoming environment. Interviewers made me feel comfortable which was pleasing.  I was able to interview them as well to get a feel of the department culture.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
Describe your experience?

title: Master of Accounting Major Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Master of accounting interview. Ask about the mathematical questions. Ask you background. Why UNC. Do you receive other schools offer. What is your future plan. Do you have any other questions.
Interview Questions: If you want to estimate the next year sales what information you will collect

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Invitation to interview via email in response to a submitted CV and letter of intent. Live presentation and meetings with staff, including postdocs and graduate students; tour of facilities and campus. Overall a pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: Straightforward questions pertaining to prior research.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Standard behavioral interview process - two rounds. The first was a phone screen and the second was a panel. The panel interview had two parts. The first part was Q&A and the second part required a presentation.
Interview Questions: I don't recall but google behavioral based interview questions. They are really standard questions.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter was very friendly and helpful. She scheduled an interview with the unit manager for the following week. The interview with the manager was very relaxed and conversational, allowing me to ask many questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about an individual who served as a mentor to you and how it has impacted your role as a nurse.

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Make video about yourself and fill out demographic info. Additionally also include transcripts and first and second choices for what classes you want to TA for and what grade you got for them
Interview Questions: Tell me why you want to be a TA?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: In-person interview at UNC with the program director, HR, and program manager, Standard interview questions. Overall a great experience. Everyone appeared engaged and interested. Ended up being more of a conversation rather than an interrogation.
Interview Questions:
Q: Introduce yourself 
Q: Explain a time when you dealt with a challenge.

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: There was not an interview process. You just need to do well in the class.  They need undergraduate teaching assistants because there are not enough. It was very easy to apply.
Interview Questions: There was not an interview so there were no questions

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Very quick and easy, they asked about my resume and it turns out that I was a perfect fit for the job that I applied for. I went on to work for the company for three years.
Interview Questions: What is your best skill set?

title: Accounting Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Asked about my previous experience and how that related to the job description.  I heard back that same day but the hiring process took about a month.  There is orientation provided by UNC which goes over your benefits offered to the employee.
Interview Questions: What grant management experience do you have?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Casual with a department head. They just wanted to understand my experience and motivations for entering the research program. Overall, I had a very genuine conversation about my career thoughts and goals.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this STEM research program?

title: Direct Care Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: lots of wait, lots of paper work, lots of training. it's a state job, a good job. the interviewers are nice, real people, not trying to intimidate you. very welcoming, but professional.
Interview Questions: a time when you dealt with a challenging co worker

title: Administrative Support Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: My situation was very unique- I was interviewed as a temp and was actually on a train back from another interview when I got called in. They made an exception for my interview by allowing a video conference call. It was pretty straightforward- tell me about yourself, why do you want this job, where do you see yourself in five to ten years, etc.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Housekeeping Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Two managers about twenty mins of senario questions. Direct atmosphere. Private interview. The managers were very kind and encouraging.  You meet HR in the meeting and you know who to go to with any concerns.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Co-chair Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Quick doc responses and tough individual interviews. Then an incredibly stressful group interview. The doc was not that hard to fill out. The individual interview was okay but the group interview killed me.
Interview Questions: Draw a basketball play on the board

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Mine Run, VA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Process very friendly cool fun. Exhiting. For all else not sure what to say really. Jusf a regular job interview. Process went smooth. Hear back after a few days so process was fats. No offer but good company.
Interview Questions: How would ai describe myself

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: First I had a phone call with the hiring manager and then we met in person. It was a smooth process  overall. I heard back pretty soon after I submitted my application.
Interview Questions: STAR based questions - a time you worked in a time, a time when you had to make a difficult decision

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC)
Interview Descriptions: There was only one interview, very behavioral. I was asked situational questions (ie. what would you do). The community directors were very nice and made you feel comfortable. They realize that you are a student first.
Interview Questions: Your shift is over and you have to get to class but your replacement isnt in the office yet. What do you do?

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Not great. Was strung along on a job opportunity for 6 months, then rejected. Multiple interviews with teams of up to 14 people, promised updates, heard nothing until I followed up multiple times.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: it was an interview that uses the STAR technique. a lot of questions were "name a time when.." type which i hate. so be prepared to give examples, how you handled the situation and outcome........
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to deal with a conflict

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: I was flown down to interview for admission to the BBSP program, which is an umbrella program that allows you to choose from one of fourteen degree programs after your first year. During the interview day, I had five 30 minute interviews with PIs.
Interview Questions: Most interviews were focused on my research experience. They asked high-level questions.

title: Administrative Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was called and screened directly by the hiring manager, and then scheduled for a video interview.  During the video interview, I spoke with the hiring manager and one of my colleagues who is sort of a jr manager.  Afterwards, I was told that it would be a few weeks before I heard anything, but then was called 2 days later to schedule an in-person interview.  During the in-person interview, I met with the department manager, as well as 2 chairs for the department.  After the interview, I was again told it would be several weeks before I heard because the university tended to move slowly, but I got called 1 or 2 days later by the department manager who informally offered me the position, but told me to wait for my offer letter to be received via email.
Interview Questions: Greatest strength, greatest weakness; What do you do when your workload is low?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: You will know once you go for the interview. Every advisor is different so there is no generalized process. Basically you have to do a Skype interview or if they are very impressed they will fly you in
Interview Questions: PhD related questions and presentation

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: overall very nice. both managers were kind and not intimidating. didn't ask too many "behavioral" questions that were difficult to answer. pretty standard interview. tried to make me feel comfortable
Interview Questions: Describe a unit project I worked on in the past

title: Telecommunications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Easy - Panel Interview; behavioral based interview questions. Phone interview took place first, then met with department personnel for 2 hours followed by a few skills test. Was scheduled a few days later to meet with the department manager one on one.
Interview Questions: Behavioral Based Interview

title: Revenue Cycle Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, in-person group/skype interview with situational questions (remember the STAR method) Billing test that is taken alone. Books are supplied. Given an hour to complete. Very easy if you have experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to work closely with someone whose personality was very different from yours.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Emailed PI directly with my CV and a reference letter. We scheduled a phone interview the next week, and we had a very nice conversation about my experience in details and their works about 30 mins.
Interview Questions: What's your skills and current salary

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Quick and effective, open communication about expectations of the position and their hiring process. Were happy to talk more about project details and details of the position.  The interviewers were friendly and clearly excited about the work they were doing. They gave me a tour of the lab space and the building I would be working in should I get the position.
Interview Questions: What is your previous lab experience?

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Very brief phone interview with two people who seemed unprepared and flustered. When I asked about the program and department, a question you would think is expected, they were very unspecific.
Interview Questions: Can you describe a time when you had to handle competing desired outcomes?

title: Contracts Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via email to set up a phone screen within a couple of days of applying online.  The phone screen lasted about 45 minutes. The person interviewing me was very friendly and easy to talk to. She let me know about two weeks later that someone with university setting experience (something I didn’t have) had been hired.
Interview Questions: How would my previous experience with contracts apply to this position.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by a researcher and a project coordinator through a video call. Was asked several questions by both people to determine what position, what projects, and what tasks I would be best suited for.
Interview Questions: How is your academic experience relevant to the position that you are interested in?

title: Marketing Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was conducted by video (pre-COVID). A variety of departmental staff gathered around an office computer to ask me questions. For the music department, you would think those faculty members knew about acoustics, but no. There was echo and feedback throughout the interview that made it difficult to hear and respond effectively.  It was obvious they were fishing for a very specific skill set that had not been made clear on the job posting, which wasn't suitable for me or them. I was content with being turned down after the experience, but I'm sure whomever got the job is enjoying it.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience with website design and management. / What is your experience with the department's subject matter (in this instance, it was the music school).

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions:
Phone - on site
Provided an offer after a phone interview then required an on-site interview later. 
After talking with the lab manager, ono on one talk with several lab members.
Interview Questions: your background

title: HR Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fair, nothing tricky about it. Standard questions were asked. I had two interviews a background check and a reference check before being offered the position. It took several months.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you had to deal with a difficult customer.

title: CRA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Good experience. Easy questions. Previous experience.  Question: Describe a mistake you made at work, how you handled it, and what you learned from it. Tell me about a time when you made a mistake? What did you do in response and what was the outcome?
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: For a university position, I felt like the interview process was very fast. I applied, interviewed twice, and received an offer in the course of about 2.5 weeks. Organization was very quick to follow-up with decisions after each interview. They conducted themselves extremely professionally and efficient.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a project in which you restructured part of your organization.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions:
interview with three people. call me when to the the interview. three people interviewed me. asked a lot of question. stayed there for an hour. 
they asked details about work history. they asked why I chose this job
Interview Questions: work history, education, why chose us

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview for this; I applied to the Department of Anthropology and was accepted. The TA position is part of the acceptance package. There is no hiring and interview process; when you accept the offer letter stating that you want to come to UNC, you receive a stipend that is contingent upon serving as a TA for the fall and spring semesters.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Apply online first, then interview with the first professor via phone. Then the second round of the interview was with the chairman of the department. Offer was received 1 week after the 2nd interview
Interview Questions: Interview questions are very standard such as tell me about your self, why do you want to come to UNC, what's your research experience, tell me you understanding about xx theories, etc.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Because I am not local I had 2 phone interviews. If you pass those you will have a in person interview and then I assume that is the last of the interview process.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Sales Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Group and individual interviews to assess qualifications and cultural fit. Organization looking for particular work experience and background not on this resume even though granted this interview. Most interviewers were cordial.
Interview Questions: Experience

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, got an email within the week, met with the manager that week, and started about a week later. It was a quick and easy process. I had applied to other GA positions without hearing anything.
Interview Questions: Nothing out of the usual, describe your experience, etc.

title: Student Services Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Meet with two panels of current employees. They asked great questions and were very open about the position/what they were looking for.  The group was very open and I really enjoyed meeting everyone I talked with.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had to work on a tight timeline?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Meeting with three different managers taking a bath 3 hours each manager had about 20 questions about work and how you will perform in different situations it seems to be very well organized with a lot of support from each department wanting you to succeed
Interview Questions: How would you handle an employee that was difficult to work with how would you handle a situation when employees took extra time during lunch continuously what would you do if you felt work was distributed unfairly

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied through UNC website, got a response fairly fast. Then a preliminary phone interview with the person looking to hire, then a  Skype interview with other members of the lab. The whole skype process lasted a half day.
Interview Questions: Very typical interview process and question for this position. Nothing out of the ordinary.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Charlotte, NC) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: recommended by a referee, and given the interview with email and skype. We talked about my personal situation and my previous projects. We also talked about the projects I am going to do.
Interview Questions: describe one of my previous projects.

title: Research Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: UNC requires that 3 people interview. It may take a while to schedule or hear back due to the multiple review levels. Working with HR people and Principal Investigator, plus usually members of the research team. Background check is required.
Interview Questions:
1. Provide specific examples of what worked well and what went off-the-rails? 
2. How do you handle something that isn't working as planned.

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line, about 3 weeks later was contacted to schedule a phone interview.  A week later had a 3 people phone screen that lasted about 30 mins.
Interview Questions: questions pertaining resume

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Email exchange with senior faculty member followed by in-person, ~60 min interview. Discussion centered around background (research and clinical), goals (short and long term), understanding of program structure and opportunities, and closed with focus on mentorship options and active projects / ways to connect. Highly personalized approach and emphasis on fit over credentials.
Interview Questions: How would a postdoc fellowship with us help us reach your long term goals?

title: Technology Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of interview. Mostly behavioral questions were asked. Some technical questions, such as 2-step and supporting Windows, Office 365, etc. Enterprise environment, that's very structured. The first one was a video call, second an in-person interview.
Interview Questions: How well do you work in a team?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview was incredibly brief and straightforward -- I interviewed with a current Community Director and  Resident Advisor.  The interview was scheduled for February, but I did not hear back about my status until the end of March.
Interview Questions: What are your biggest strengths?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process took around 3 months from submitting my application in mid-October to the final decision being made at the end of January. The first interview was a phone interview with 2 people from the office. Basic questions were asked about my qualifications. Nearly 3 weeks later I was e-mailed and asked to come in for an in person interview. I had 5 interviews that day ranging from 30 minutes to an hour. Again, typical interview questions were asked. It was implied at this interview that a hiring decision would be made within the next week. Two weeks later I received an e-mail stating the committee had decided to bring back the candidates for a final round of interviews that were meant to determine whether the person would fit into the culture of the office. This was a one-on-one interview that lasted approximately two hours. I received an e-mail 3 weeks later from HR informing me I was not chosen. Overall the interview process was handled incredibly poorly by the head of the hiring committee. Interviews were scheduled days before and were rescheduled on two occasions. Additionally, I frequently had my e-mail correspondence ignored and never received any type of communication from the head of the hiring committee once a decision had been reached. Incredibly unprofessional people on the hiring committee and overall a poor representation of UNC.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had to make a quick decision. How did it turn out?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: A weekend of interviews. Nice people and beautiful campus. Very interesting research. Innovative and collaborative research groups. I would highly recommend this school because I learned so much and gain alot of support to achieve my career goals.
Interview Questions: What previous research experience do you have?

title: PharmD Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: It is MMI (multiple mini interviews.) You will be assisted in a group with 5 pharmacy students and go into 7-10 rooms with an interviewer sit inside and answer question. Every room has different questions asked.
Interview Questions: You pair with another student and one person look at a picture that describe the pattern on the picture and another student draw it out based on their description

title: Os Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Talked to coordinator at an event the night before school started. Went in for the interview, got the job, now working part time along with school. definitely suggest it and recommend it to anyone
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC)
Interview Descriptions: First you apply online and answer questions, upload your resume and add a reference. After that original screening, as long as you meet the GPA requirement (2.5) and wrote something decent, you'll move on to individual interviews. If you make it past the individual interviews then you'll attend group process. After group process, approximately a third will be released from the process, a third will be put on the alternate list an a third will be hired.
Interview Questions: How would you incorporate diversity into your residence hall?

title: Business Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews - 1 phone interview, and one in person panel review.  The first phone interview utilized typical questions.  The second interview was with the Department chairman, HR rep, and Business Officer.  It lasted about an hour.  It was a bit intimidating with the department chairmen there, but the two admin were very approachable.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you made a mistake.  Tell us about your relevant work experience.

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was on the long side as with any higher education hiring process, but it was still a pleasant experience overall.  The individuals that I met with were all very amicable, and I received a call from the hiring manager within two weeks after the last interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Masters Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Skype Interview with one of the school (not program) staff. Never seen her again throughout the program. Very general questions. Very formal interview process. Talked about undergraduate, activities, and hobbies. If you are UNC undergraduate, you are pretty set and the acceptance rate is high.
Interview Questions: Why UNC, Why Major

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied in October, 1st Interview about a month afterward. Did a second interview a week or so later. Background check in late November/early December. Job offer a couple weeks after. Began in January
Interview Questions: It was quite informal. I was mostly asked about the type of experience I enjoyed versus settings I disliked and why.

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: very relaxed, just asked about my background, and what were my interests -- if i were to not have much on my resume, i would have probably gotten grilled however
Interview Questions: How do you balance a tradeoff between the runtime and memory complexity?

title: Technology Support Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone interview, no technical questions asked,  just standard personality questions. It was a very laid back interview, it didn't seem like there was a real answer they were looking for for each question, but rather all the questions together. They wanted to know when I would be able to start.
Interview Questions: How do you respond to pressure?

title: ICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: phone interview, interview with recruiter face to face, interview with unit manager and other staff, shadow day.  It was all very straight forward. I did apply to 15 positions and I was only called back for one, I was later told it was related to my lack of experience. The areas I wanted to work in are specialties like the OR
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work on that unit? What I liked to do in my spare time. Do I like working with others. What do I bring to the unit.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Focuses on experience, and why you want to work here. They want you to stay, so do not appear wishy-washy about the job if you really want it. They value effort and want to know you are a team player.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position? What can you offer us?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted directly by the potential boss. I met with every member of the office. The panel included at least five people. Interview lasted around 45 min.  Atmosphere was friendly and welcoming. They asked questions about event management, fellowship/scholarship administration, international experience, and administration experience.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position? What is your experience managing fellowships?

title: Assistant Director, Career & Leadership Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: The first round consisted of a phone interview, followed by another interview. The first only one person interviewed me via phone. The second phone interview, two people inquired about my experience.  Then I waited and finally got an email inviting me to choose a day for an in-person interview that aactually consisted of back to back with only one short break interviews of people - most were teams - a few were alone. The end of the process consisted of me delivering a presentation of 20 minutes to approx. 20 people. This entire process (on-site) was approximately 4 - 5- hours long.
Interview Questions: What would be hardest for you to do in terms of the job description....

title: Admissions Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone conference/interview with six people. It was difficult to ascertain who was asking questions (I think I was the first candidate with this process). Surprised there were so many people on the call for a first pass.
Interview Questions: What is my take on UNC branding?

title: Digital Media Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: First, you will meet a group of School employees who I have worked with as the School’s web developer. This group meeting will be more informal, it will last for 45 minutes, and will give you the chance to learn more about our culture and people in addition to sharing about yourself.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself. Your experiences and interests in this position. An evaluation of their website.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: First I submitted cover letter and resume via email, then I was called for a telephone interview, then I was asked in for an in-person interview. During the interview I was interviewed by two people who took turns asking questions, one of which was to be my future boss.
Interview Questions: What is one of your weaknesses?

title: Radiologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: the first interview is a video call interview and the 2nd interview is a face to face interview. It was pretty straight forward, asked about the experience, some technical questions. also, what are you specified in
Interview Questions: weaknesses and strengths

title: Graduate Teaching Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Each interview was dependent on the faculty member for whom I would be working. Many behavioral interviewing questions were asked. Nothing too surprising about the interviews. I needed one more sentence.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had a conflict with a supervisor, and how did you handle it?

title: Environmental of Care Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: On April 5th I received a call to come in for a in person interview for April 12th. April 6th received a call and asked if I could rescheduled it for April 18th. I then received a email with the interview scheduled it was going to be 4 different interviews over 2 hours and a walk around the building. On April 18th showed up to the interview after having it rescheduled two of the people that were going to interview me didn't show up in the first interview. In the second interview the guy walked me around and showed me my office he was also cussing which I found inappropriate. The third interview was just a sit down meet and greet and so was the last interview. Didn't meet with a HR rep until the last interview, which makes me question how do they put this selection committee together?? On May 5th three weeks after my interview received a email telling me I didn't get the job. Overall bad experience and waste of my time.
Interview Questions: All behavioral questions

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: There is an interview and if you make it past the first interview, there is a group process phase. The group process phase includes a few activities that you do with other applicants that test different aspects of the job.
Interview Questions: There were no unexpected questions. They were all pretty straight forward if you prepare.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Reply to email with interest in research position, attend an interview meeting with other candidates and talk about your research interests as well as your past experience. Make sure you do not have scheduling conflicts because it is important for research assistants to have flexible schedules.
Interview Questions: Out of your experiences, what has best prepared you to work in our research lab.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Charlotte, NC) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Questions, emails going well and singing dancing unc rules you all go apply for unc they worth it. The best professors, good students, interesting lectures football chorus. Be ready and prepared it saves lives.
Interview Questions: Why are you intersted in this position

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: many interviews with many different people that took several hours and sometimes several days to coordinate,very cumbersome, time consuming, sometimes had to wait for someone for 20-30 minutes. also took 6 weeks to get a response after submitting my resume and completing the application
Interview Questions: what would i do in a situation when being badgered by a physician

title: Library Services Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process took one hour. I had a feeling the committee already had an applicant in mind and I was there to meet quota. The interview is the standard panel Q&A with a few questions related to the position. I was interviewed by three men. The committee has to write down every response. In one part of the interview, on of the committee members rolled is eyes at me while I gave a response. Completely unprofessional. In the later half of the interview, another member laughed at one of my questions. I was appauled. I was thankful for the gentleman that was professional. The actions of the committee turned me off and I was no longer interested.
Interview Questions:
Behavioral Questions
Customer Service Questions
Time Management
Management skills

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was ran by idiots. The seemed not to understand basic technological concepts, and were stuck with ridiculous concepts of work and learning from MIT Media Lab. In particular, a large amount of the older faculty had clearly checked out from reality, and the younger faculty thought of themselves as a sort of genius despite being stuck at a second-rate school in the South.
Interview Questions: They asked about my desired teaching load and experience getting grants.

title: Accounting Processor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty normal. The job duties weren't that difficult so they just wanted to make sure I had a basic understanding of accounting so that permanence would be a possibility
Interview Questions: Do you prefer working in team or individual settings? Have you ever worked with peoplesoft, connect carolina, or microsoft office?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen and then in person 3 hour interview with 6 staff members.  Too much for entry level position that was just for basically sitting at the front desk.
Interview Questions: Resume Walk

title: IT Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Once you submit your resume, they'll review it and reach back out to you for availability for a single in-person interview. The interview covers basic IT skills as well as communication and interpersonal skills that will benefit you as a client-facing employee.
Interview Questions: What does RAM stand for?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Overly-complicated, long day (over 8 hours total) for what was essentially an executive assistant position.  (Am comparing this with other, higher position for which I have applied).  Met with dean and assistant dean; also had to interview with four different panels.  Lunch w/ dean and assistant dean.  A writing exam as part of the interview.  (Little surprised at that because they mentioned several times that they had only selected the 4 candidates out of 200+ because of our well-written, organized, and thorough cover letters, as well as the articles I had written.)
Interview Questions:
Why did you apply for this position?
How do you prioritize your tasks?
How do you keep up with multiple, conflicting deadlines?
What was your biggest disappointment?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
How would your current supervisor describe you?
How do you handle conflict or confrontation?  Provide an example.
What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Office Manager At the OCT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied in May of 2015.  I received an e-mail to set up a phone interview in August.  Had the phone interview at the end of August.  I then was invited for a panel interview in November.  At the end of November I was offered the position and told it would begin in January.  

As January came, I was told they were having trouble working with HR and getting my BG check done.  Then the end of January came and February began.  That is when I was told they were having troubles financing the position.  I just received the official e-mail at the end of April that the job is no more.  

DO NOT waste your time with UNC Chapel Hill.
Interview Questions: When did you have a lot to balance at one time and how did you deal with it?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward, great administrative staff support through the process. Everyone very open and informative about living and working in the area, also open to email contact for additional information if needed.
Interview Questions: What my future plans were and how my time at Unc could help reach them.

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
No phone interview (unusual for most jobs here). In person interview with the three person hiring committee. Second interview was with a selection of members from the whole IT Department.
The first set of questions were very specific and focused on how I would handle certain situations in this role. The second interview were more laid back questions and focused more broadly on how I would work with the department and what I would like to improve.
Interview Questions: How I would handle consulting with a professor regarding what kind of computer to purchase.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward typical academic job interview. Standard 1 hr research presentation followed by discussions with current lab members and personal interview with PI. A lunch meet and dinner with grad students was geared towards a more informal discussion of life around Chapel Hill
Interview Questions: What I wanted to do in the role I was being hired

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met with 2 recruiters and went over my experience and answered basic questions. 2 days later I was offered the position. It was very easy going, was not invasive at all. Was more of a get to know. I could tell I got the job mid interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the float pool

title: Accounting Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Medford, MA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I got the interview two weeks after application. It was a 30-min skype call with mainly behavior questions. Start me resume and past experiences. And another big part was why I am interested in accounting. I gave some general answers that correlates with my experience. A third one I remember is what is the challenge and things to catch up if you were admitted.
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is easy. Had a skype interview and offered the job after three weeks. But the administrative processing took nearly two more weeks. The whole process is done without any complications.
Interview Questions: They asked about the previous work experience and the technical expertise mentioned in the cv

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: I was sent an email the day before saying they would call me the next day at 10 AM. I spoke to the main associate for 15/20 mins and then another research assistant for 10 mins. Many of the questions were about the skills I gained in school and how they would help me with the internship.
Interview Questions: What do you hope to gain from this experience?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Casual interview, quick and professional with genuine interest in personal interests and goals. It was conducted in the morning in a professor's office. Nothing atypical, just a basic question and interview, but the professor tried to make it conversational which was helpful for reducing nerves. Great first impression of the department and staff.
Interview Questions: What lead you to apply for this position?

title: S&T Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very relaxed, with a mix of technicals, personal, and behavioral questions. The interview was conducted in a two to one manner, which seems intimidating as first, but the key is to present yourself equally to both, and remembering both of their names.
Interview Questions: Know about probability and statistics based questions.

title: Business Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with the search committee - 4 people. Then I was flown down for a half day of interviews - 1 with the hiring manager, 1 with HR, 1 with the search committee, 1 with the team that I would be working with, and 1 open to anyone in the school who wanted to attend.
Interview Questions: They asked about a time when I had a conflict with a co-worker & what was the outcome.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Met and interviewed with five different members of upper management. I heard back from my soon to be direct supervisor about a week and a half later. Sometime it takes them a while to get the job all squared away with hr.
Interview Questions:
Question: Tell me about yourself.
Question: Why are you the right person for this job?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC)
Interview Descriptions: The interview is very easy, which might is because the position is open to the graduate student in the research lab. Casual conversation with a group of professors and other research fellow. Mostly are research questions. All the questions are open question which encourage the candidate to have individual opinions.
Interview Questions: very casual conversation, some research questions. All the questions are open question which encourage the candidate to have individual opinions.

title: CNA II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online.  HR representative called me.  Interviewed with 2 managers.  Within several days was offered a position.  Managers were easy to talk to.  They score you on how you answer questions.  Interview lasted about 1/2 an hour.  Gave me a tour of the unit.  Talked with several NAs and nurses about working on the unit.
Interview Questions: Described how you handled a problem with another staff member.  Described how you handled a tough patient.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Phone calls and onsite interviews. Great experience, very friendly and coordinate with you very well. Great experience, very friendly and coordinate with you very well. Great experience, very friendly and coordinate with you very well.
Interview Questions: What is your skill sets?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I am a more experienced worker (older 52) seeking  a more or less entry level job to retrain myself. I had dozens of interviews and no offers. Then a millennial mentioned I should not wear a suit to the interview. (I was always told to show respect and wear a suit) i tried it and switched to dress shirt and pants and received 2 offers on my next 3 interviews!!
Interview Questions: Mostly science. And convincing them I'm OK with entry level.

title: Senior Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Series of video chats along with phone and in-person interviews.  There were many separate interviews held with various stakeholders within the organization.  Although long, I enjoyed the process as it was a good way to meet many of the people I would interact with on a daily basis once in the organization.
Interview Questions: How would you handle online payments?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application online and was contacted by Nursing HR promptly.  I met with my manager at her office and got a chance to shadow on my unit for up to 12 hours.  I was asked about my background and some things on my resume, and the rest of the interview was composed of behavioral interview-type questions.  It lasted 45 minutes to an hour.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a challenge you faced in the past.  How did you deal with it?

title: Systems Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Meet with about 4 Managers one VP, and the team. Illustrate on black board. Each manager reviews your resume and asks questions about each position. in addition to there own questions, they have a set of generic questions that they read off a sheet; most likely from HR. Seems like great people to work with - looks like a lot of work, but they have a team for many aspects of IT.
Interview Questions: What is the most rewarding project I worked on.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a great interview process, and it was one of the best interviews I have ever had.  People were very nice and it made me not nervous.  I say go apply and give it a shot, it might take a while to hear back, but it's worth it.
Interview Questions: What can you do?

title: BSC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer didn't make the interview to intense. She was really nice and we talked as if we had known each other for a long time.  She didn't have to ask many questions because they came out naturally via conversation.
Interview Questions: What are some of your weakness in the work field?

title: Medicaid Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I received a call after 3 weeks. I had a phone interview. One week later I had an onsite interview. I interviewed with two teams of 3 people for about one hour each. The questions were behaviorally based. The director lost interest and made it know by her comments towards the end. Seemed like she wanted a lay down and take it type person. Too headstrong you won't make it in.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you worked with a group of people, what did you have to do and what was the outcome.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 interviews. Meetings were 1:1 with different staff members. Questions were straightforward and laid back. The atmosphere was friendly and inviting. Overall, it was a positive experience. Visiting the working space was very informative and played a huge role in decision making.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Human Resources Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a three part interview. First part consisted of phone screen with department HR contact. Second was an in-person panel interview consisting of personality and skills questions. Third was in-person interview with hiring manager/department manager, when I was given the opportunity to fill out the background check authorization.
Interview Questions: Most personality-based interview questions relating to job experiences. Nothing too extraordinary.

title: Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Multiple people have to interview you and it takes a lot of time. Length of time from interview to hire is long. Be prepared to wait. Interview process is intensive and time intensive.
Interview Questions: Tell me one negative thing people would say about you

title: Facilities Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Typical yet thorough. Just be yourself, personable, and professional. A sense of humor is important while demonstrating a balanced work/life ethic. Don't embellish and ask questions of the panel about both corporate and personnel endeavors. Show that your human. Establish your leadership style and see if there's a match across the panel and potential co-workers.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: The process was incredibly slow as it was months before I was called for an interview.  I was phone screened by 4 people asking basic questions about the position.  I was not invited for an onsite interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you created order from chaos.
