title: Patient Registration Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I got a call to do a phone interview, then three weeks later I was called to be interviewed by a panel. The entire process was long and tedious. I got a call from the supervisor just asking me some personal questions and my current work experience. The panel was a little intimidating as I was not used to being interviewed by a group. They were very friendly during the interview process though.
Interview Questions:
Goals?
Work ability?
Punctuality?
How do you work with a team?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: a process takes a while to call after application submission sometimes.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: You are not required to take an interview. Teaching assistant decisions are made with offer to to attend graduate program. Decisions made by your individual department, then ratified by the graduate school. If you receive an offer of admission you will be a teaching assistant unless you are also offered a fellowship to attend. This will relieve you of teaching assistant duties and allow you more time to focus on your work.
Interview Questions: No questions asked as no interview given.

title: Major Gift Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, phone interview and panel interview. I was told I was "meeting" with two people for my phone interview, but I was not informed of the panel interview. The process was somewhat lengthy due to the multiple background checks.
Interview Questions: All of the questions were very straight-forward and typical HR questions (i.e. Tell us about a time when you had to give someone bad news. Tell us about your greatest strength.)

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went quick after couple poor candidates. It took a weeks to get phone call from HR after interviews with employer. The hiring process took months to get the benefit valid.
Interview Questions: Interview was ok. Ask technical questions based on past experience.

title: Human Resources Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Apply online. Arrive early because parking can be an issue. Initial in-person interview was with 3 people- the team leads and their manager. Second in- person interview was with 10 team members. All were welcoming, informative, and professional. During both, interviewers took turns asking scripted questions. Be prepared- their questions cover a wide range and are behavioral event interview style questions. They all allowed me to ask questions and answered them openly.
Interview Questions: nothing that I remember to be particularly surprising or difficult.

title: Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: On campus interview with ~3 other candidates.  Met many faculty and staff throughout the day. Toured the various labs.  Asked a lot about my previous lab experiences.  Process was not meant to test me, instead meant to get acquainted with my abilities and one another's expectations.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by the primary investigator via email to notice of onsite interview. Met with primary investigator and a few individual lab members. Gave a presentation about my previous research work. A few weeks afterwards, was noticed by email from primary investigator about the offer. Salary was sort of fixed and didn't have much room for negotiation.
Interview Questions: Got asked by PI and lab members for questions related to my presentation talk.

title: Certified Ophthalmic Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: You were to answer questions to different scenarios that they would place you in. They asked your strengthens and weaknesses. They had you give examples of different tests and how you use them in the clinical setting.
Interview Questions: If a patient became disgruntled during an examination, what would you do?

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the UNC website in November and heard back in December. Went through a phone interview, which went well, but received an email a few weeks later indicating that they were moving forward with another candidate that more closely matched their business needs.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 5 employers/employees, one on one. Casual conversation-based interview, where they asked who I am, why I want to work for them, what I can contribute to the lab/clinic, and where I want to be in 5 years.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Community Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by a long wait time until I was invited on campus. Stayed in an on campus apartment and had meals with their staff. Good orientation to the campus and department.
Interview Questions: How would you work with students who succeed at a high academic level?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Resume and cover letter submitted, phone interview followed by an in person interview. I met with ENTIRE staff. Questions were asked. They also asked for a writing sample and several other examples of work which seemed like over kill. An offer was made by phone from HR. I was told that salary and benefits were not negotiable.
Interview Questions: What kind of work culture do you thrive in?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was on campus and it was very professionally run. At the same time, it was relaxed and I never felt like I was on the hot seat or people were looking for flaws.
Interview Questions: What classes I would like to teach.

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Quick, one-time meeting with the team I planned don working with. Because this was a part-time position, the interview process was very casual. They were most interested in how I would fit into the team.
Interview Questions: What skills do you have that would qualify you for this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with different faculty members based on aligned research interests. Each took about 45 min to an hour and I was asked different questions in each individual interview. After my round of interviews, I was asked to list in descending order of preference of faculty members to work with. A few weeks after this process I heard back about my admission.
Interview Questions: Why choose UNC? What are your expectations of the work?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my online application and did not hear back from 4+ weeks.  I received an email asking for a phone interview, which I completed.  Shortly after, I was asked in for an office interview.  Once this was completed, I received an offer within 10 days.  The hiring process is long, however- it was several months before I began the position.
Interview Questions: I was not asked very many question during the interview, it was mostly them explaining the position to me.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: My interview goes by about 30 min. He asked me my previous job duties in the lab and my techniques in the resume.
Interview Questions: How I handle when I have conflict between lab members.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC)
Interview Descriptions: direct commnication and interviews via skype
Interview Questions: what can you do to progress the research?

title: Drug Dev Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Research Triangle Park, NC) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, came to visit for face to face interview
Interview Questions: Hypothetical question to explain clinical trial.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions:
It was a classic postdoc interview, I came and gave a ~30-40 min presentation on my previous research project, answered a few topical questions. Then there were 20-40 min one on one conversations with the lab members. I mainly listened and showed interest in what people do in the lab.
Then there i attended a meeting covering my prospective project. Through the participation I tried to suggest possible project development pathways and demonstrate my understanding on the field.
It lasted about 5-6 hrs total, and I was absolutely exhausted at the end of it. Everybody was very friendly yet reserved.
Interview Questions: What improvements do you see for our current model? (after a presentation of the prospective work project)

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got invitation to interview in 2 weeks.  Interviewed with Principal Investigator, then Research Assistant Professor and Lab manager together.  Asked normal questions: to elaborate or describe previous job skills, explained current projects they wanted to hire for.  This varies for each lab, but it was friendly and informative.  They wanted to know what they could do for you as well as what you could do for them.  Tour of the lab, grabbed coffee.
Interview Questions: How would you make a 0.1M solution?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very basic asked more about my previous masters research and education. Simultaneously the interviewer explained the research area and focus of UNC. Underwent two interview calls  and within one month or so got the admission for Phd.
Interview Questions: How would you apply the masters skills in the PhD research? Tell me about your education and prior research experience.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was out of the country during the process, so we communicated by phone and email. Everything was between the principal investigator and me (several emails, two phone interviews). The interview consisted in science questions about my experience in the lab and about the project I would be working here. No HR involved.
Interview Questions: All questions were science related, asking for my experience in the lab.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Spoke to manager initially in store after sign asking for hours to be filled was posted. Got called about 2 weeks later and had an early morning interview. Interview lasted about 20 minutes and I was hired on the spot. Simply had to relate to the manager to get the job. Very laid back.
Interview Questions: Tell about a difficult decision you've had to make

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process lasted about 4 ours where recruiter asked you a lot of questions and than transfer you to other teams for lengthy interview.
Interview Questions: Most of questions where looking into your responds to problem that were encounter with the job and the way it was solved

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed through BBSP, the umbrella program that encompasses all of the biological programs and departments. I met with four faculty members for 45 minute interviews in which they described their research to me and I described my research to them. It was laid back and casual, although you should ask lots of questions and show enthusiasm if you want to get accepted into the program.
Interview Questions: Why did I choose UNC to apply for graduate school?

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions:
apply online on their careers site
called for interview by HR Manager (boss) (2 weeks later)
phone interview went very well
in person interview went very well
offer from main HR office (2 weeks later)
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lead Developer, Reese Felts Digital Newsroom Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Initial communication by phone and email. Asked to provide extensive, detailed information on prior projects contributed to. In person interview with department chair and search committee. Was provided transportation and overnight stay during in-person interview process. Everyone I met with was friendly and professional. Interview was held on campus at UNC Chapel Hill.
Interview Questions: No specific difficult or unexpected question. General interview questions.

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UNC Chapel Hill (Chapel Hill, NC) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was straight forward and as expected in a large organization. Applied for position through HR channels and was contacted by the hiring supervisor. The interview was scheduled quickly, but the HR bureaucracy took a while to work through.
Interview Questions: N/A
